Text: Employee 1 is clearly struggling| what should I do?
Option1: They have said they can do it and I believe them.
Option3: It would be a more efficient use of their skills to assingn Employee 2 to this task.

Text: I'll let them figure it out on their own| but should I plan for if they can't manage?
Option1: I should pay closer attention to the project and look out for mistakes.
Option2: It's important to show that I respect their capabilities without planning for their failure.
Option3: I will get Employee 2 to finish off the project so that they can correct any mistakes.

Option1: I will learn the algorithms myself so that I can help explain them to Employee 1.
Option2: I will assign Employee 2 to work along side her for support and to improve understanding.
Option3: I will go with them to the client to negotiate an easier implementation.

Text: Employee 1 will probably not like me reassigning them| how do I best tell them?
Option1: Explain that it is a more efficient use of their talents to reassign them.
Option2: Explain that Employee 2 is better suited to this task.
Option3: Explain that the project is too important to make mistakes and they can learn in thier own time.
